summary: Workflow interceptors require double configuration: once for bundler inclusion and again in WorkerOptions. When workflows are pre-bundled, WorkerOptions.interceptors.workflowModules may become unavailable since require.resolve might not work in the pre-bundled worker process.
userImpact: Users deploying pre-bundled workflows must maintain workflow interceptor paths in two places, or face runtime failures when require.resolve is unavailable.
rootCause: require.resolve does not work in pre-bundled worker processes, requiring workflow modules to be specified separately at runtime despite already being bundled.
proposedFix: Store the list of workflow interceptor modules at bundling time and automatically load them, or automatically load anything in the workflow bundle so paths only need to be specified once.
keyQuote: The worker might not have the workflows available in the file system on startup (in case it is using a workflows bundle).
